report_text: CLINICAL HISTORY: 52-year-old male with a 4.5 cm mass in the sigmoid colon identified on colonoscopy. Segmental colectomy performed. GROSS DESCRIPTION: Received is a segment of sigmoid colon measuring 18 cm in length with attached mesentery. A circumferential, ulcerated, firm mass is identified measuring 4.3 x 3.8 cm, located 5 cm from the distal margin. The mass extends through the bowel wall into the pericolonic fat. Twenty-two lymph nodes are identified in the mesentery. MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION: Sections show moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma of the colon. The tumor forms irregular glands with desmoplastic stromal reaction. Invasion through the muscularis propria into the pericolonic adipose tissue is confirmed. Lymphovascular invasion is present. Perineural invasion is present. Three of 22 lymph nodes contain metastatic adenocarcinoma. Proximal and distal resection margins are negative. Tumor budding score is high (10 buds per 0.785 mm2). DIAGNOSIS: Sigmoid colon, segmental resection: Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, pT3 pN1b (3/22), lymphovascular and perineural invasion present.

findings.description: Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma with irregular glands and desmoplastic stroma, invasion through muscularis propria into pericolonic fat
Lymphovascular invasion present, perineural invasion present, high tumor budding score
Metastatic adenocarcinoma in 3 of 22 lymph nodes

diagnosis: Sigmoid colon, segmental resection: Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, pT3 pN1b (3/22 lymph nodes positive). Lymphovascular and perineural invasion present. High tumor budding. Margins negative.

report_text: CLINICAL HISTORY: 36-year-old female with a 2.0 cm right ovarian mass found incidentally during cesarean section. Right oophorectomy performed. GROSS DESCRIPTION: Received is a right ovary measuring 4.0 x 3.0 x 2.5 cm weighing 18 grams. Sectioning reveals a well-circumscribed, solid, yellow mass measuring 2.0 x 1.8 x 1.5 cm. The remaining ovarian tissue is unremarkable. MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION: Sections show an adult granulosa cell tumor. The tumor cells are arranged in microfollicular (Call-Exner bodies), trabecular, and diffuse patterns. The cells are uniform with pale nuclei showing characteristic nuclear grooves (coffee-bean appearance). Mitotic activity is low at 2 mitoses per 10 high-power fields. No capsular invasion, hemorrhage, or necrosis is identified. The tumor is confined to the ovary. DIAGNOSIS: Right ovary, oophorectomy: Adult granulosa cell tumor, 2.0 cm, confined to the ovary, FIGO stage IA.

findings.description: Adult granulosa cell tumor with microfollicular (Call-Exner bodies), trabecular, and diffuse patterns; uniform cells with nuclear grooves; low mitotic activity

diagnosis: Right ovary, oophorectomy: Adult granulosa cell tumor, 2.0 cm, confined to the ovary, FIGO stage IA. Low mitotic activity. No capsular invasion.

report_text: CLINICAL HISTORY: 64-year-old male with a 1.8 cm enlarging parotid mass. Superficial parotidectomy performed. GROSS DESCRIPTION: Received is a superficial parotidectomy specimen measuring 6.0 x 4.5 x 2.0 cm. A well-circumscribed, partially encapsulated, firm white nodule is identified measuring 1.8 x 1.5 x 1.3 cm. MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION: Sections demonstrate a pleomorphic adenoma (benign mixed tumor). The tumor shows a biphasic pattern with epithelial and myoepithelial components set in a chondromyxoid stroma. Epithelial cells form ducts and sheets. The myoepithelial cells are spindled and plasmacytoid. The capsule is intact throughout, although focal thinning is noted. No atypia, necrosis, or invasive growth is identified. The facial nerve margin is negative. DIAGNOSIS: Right parotid gland, superficial parotidectomy: Pleomorphic adenoma (benign mixed tumor), 1.8 cm, completely excised with intact capsule.

findings.description: Pleomorphic adenoma with biphasic epithelial and myoepithelial components in chondromyxoid stroma; intact capsule with focal thinning

diagnosis: Right parotid gland, superficial parotidectomy: Pleomorphic adenoma (benign mixed tumor), 1.8 cm. Completely excised with intact capsule. No atypia or invasive features. Facial nerve margin negative.

report_text: CLINICAL HISTORY: 29-year-old male with a 3.5 cm testicular mass found on ultrasound. Left radical orchiectomy performed. Serum AFP elevated at 450 ng/mL, beta-hCG normal. GROSS DESCRIPTION: Received is a left radical orchiectomy specimen with attached spermatic cord measuring 8 cm. The testis measures 5.0 x 3.5 x 3.0 cm. Sectioning reveals a heterogeneous, tan-white to hemorrhagic mass measuring 3.4 x 2.8 x 2.5 cm with areas of necrosis. The mass is confined within the tunica albuginea. MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION: Sections show a mixed germ cell tumor composed of embryonal carcinoma (60%) and yolk sac tumor (40%). The embryonal carcinoma component shows solid sheets of large primitive cells with amphophilic cytoplasm, prominent nucleoli, and brisk mitotic activity. The yolk sac tumor component demonstrates reticular and microcystic patterns with Schiller-Duval bodies. Lymphovascular invasion is present. The tumor does not penetrate the tunica albuginea. The spermatic cord margin is negative. Rete testis invasion is identified. DIAGNOSIS: Left testis, radical orchiectomy: Mixed germ cell tumor (embryonal carcinoma 60%, yolk sac tumor 40%), pT1b. Lymphovascular invasion present.

findings.description: Mixed germ cell tumor: embryonal carcinoma (60%) with solid sheets of primitive cells and brisk mitoses; yolk sac tumor (40%) with reticular pattern and Schiller-Duval bodies
Lymphovascular invasion present, rete testis invasion identified

diagnosis: Left testis, radical orchiectomy: Mixed germ cell tumor (embryonal carcinoma 60%, yolk sac tumor 40%), 3.4 cm, pT1b. Lymphovascular invasion present. Rete testis invasion. Spermatic cord margin negative. Tumor confined within tunica albuginea.
